definition: to extend (one's limbs, one's body, etc.) in a reclining position
to reach out : extend
examples: stretched out her arms

definition: to extend in length
examples: stretched his neck to see what was going on

definition: to fell with or as if with a blow
to cause the limbs of (a person) to be pulled especially in torture
to draw up (one's body) from a cramped, stooping, or relaxed position
to pull taut
examples: canvas stretched on a frame

definition: to enlarge or distend especially by force
to extend or expand as if by physical force
examples: stretch one's mind with a good book

definition: strain
examples: stretched his already thin patience

definition: to cause to reach or continue (as from one point to another or across a space)
examples: stretch a wire between two posts

definition: to amplify or enlarge beyond natural or proper limits
examples: the rules can be stretched this once

definition: to expand (as by improvisation) to fulfill a larger function
examples: stretching a dollar

definition: to extend (a hit) to an extra base usually by fast or daring running
examples: stretch a single into a double

definition: to become extended in length or breadth or both : spread
examples: broad plains stretching to the sea

definition: to extend over a continuous period
examples: the dynasty stretches back several centuries

definition: to become extended without breaking
to extend one's body or limbs
examples: stretched before jogging
wanted to stretch out on the sofa

definition: to lie down at full length
to go beyond what is strictly warranted in making a claim or concession
to extend the legs
to take a walk in order to relieve stiffness caused by prolonged sitting
an exercise of something (such as the understanding or the imagination) beyond ordinary or normal limits
examples: their conclusion seemed like a bit of a stretch

definition: an extension of the scope or application of something
examples: a stretch of language

definition: the extent to which something may be stretched
the act of stretching : the state of being stretched
examples: a good stretch for legs

definition: the position of a pitcher standing sideways to home plate so as to keep a runner close to a base
examples: pitching from the stretch

definition: an extent in length or area
examples: an open stretch of road

definition: a continuous period of time
examples: can write for eight hours at a stretch

definition: a walk to relieve fatigue
a term of imprisonment
examples: served a 10-year stretch

definition: either of the straight sides of a racecourse, homestretch
a final stage (as of a contest or season)
examples: won some crucial games down the stretch

definition: the capacity for being stretched : elasticity
examples: a waistband with lots of stretch

definition: a stretch limousine
easily stretched : elastic
examples: a stretch wig

definition: longer than the standard size
examples: a stretch limousine
